member.name: T:FinalExamSystems.AdditionalFeesCoverage
member.summary: AdditionalFeesCoverage implements Factory Method design pattern Additional Fees Coverage is a Concrete product

member.name: T:FinalExamSystems.Airline
member.summary: This is the Airline class, which belongs to an individual airline and manages the Brands (which have the Flights and Planes), Employees and the cancellation policies This Airline class applies the Singleton pattern. Because this is an Airline Reservation System, that is meant for a single airline, we decided to apply to singleton pattern to the airline class, meaning there will only be one instance of the Airline class.

member.name: F:FinalExamSystems.Airline.airlineInstance
member.summary: This is the public field that will contain the single instance of the airline class

member.name: M:FinalExamSystems.Airline.#ctor
member.summary: This is the constructor for the Airline class which cannot be instantiated directly as it is protected

member.name: M:FinalExamSystems.Airline.GetAirlineInstance
member.summary: This method returns the singleton instance of the Airline class, if it does not exist it instantiates an instance (this happens only once) and returns the instance.

member.name: P:FinalExamSystems.Airline.Name
member.summary: This method returns the singleton instance of the Airline class, if it does not exist it instantiates an instance (this happens only once)

member.name: P:FinalExamSystems.Airline.Brands
member.summary: This property contains all the Brands in the current Airline Instance

member.name: P:FinalExamSystems.Airline.CancellationPolicy
member.summary: This property contains the CancellationPolicy that the Airline is following

member.name: P:FinalExamSystems.Airline.Employees
member.summary: This property contains all the Employees in the current Airline Instance

member.name: T:FinalExamSystems.Flight
member.summary: This is the Flight class which is an instance of a Plane that is taking a Route from one Airport to another Airport This Flight class applies the Information Expert pattern. This is because the Flight class aggregates all the seats in the Flight in the seats field, therefore because it has all the information of the seats, the method of getting available seats in Flight (GetAvailableSeats) is defined in the Flight class (information expert)

member.name: P:FinalExamSystems.Flight.DepartureTime
member.summary: This property defines the departure time of the flight

member.name: P:FinalExamSystems.Flight.Duration
member.summary: This property defines the total duration of the flight

member.name: P:FinalExamSystems.Flight.Seats
member.summary: This property contains all the Seats of the Flight

member.name: P:FinalExamSystems.Flight.Route
member.summary: This property defines the Route of the flight

member.name: P:FinalExamSystems.Flight.FlightClass
member.summary: This property defines the class of Flight

member.name: P:FinalExamSystems.Flight.FlightNumber
member.summary: This property defines the flight number of the current instance

member.name: P:FinalExamSystems.Flight.Status
member.summary: This property defines the status that the flight is currently in

member.name: M:FinalExamSystems.Flight.GetAvailableSeats
member.summary: This method gets the seats that are available, it is in the Flight class as the Flight is the information expert with all the seat information

member.summary: FlightClass class is the class type for a Flight

member.name: T:FinalExamSystems.IPaymentServiceAdapter
member.summary: This class is the Adapter Interface that handles payments. It allows the use of the Adapter Design Pattern where this interface is converted into a CreditCardPaymentAdapter or PaypalPaymentAdapter based on the Customer's choice of payment method Additionally the protected variations pattern is used because as the IPaymentServiceAdapter interface adds a level of indirection, variations in external API's (payment method services in this case) will still result in the system being protected. We are also applying the Indirection pattern as we are assigning the responsibility of payments to an intermediary object (IPaymentServiceAdapter) so that objects around it donâ€™t have to be coupled directly.

member.name: M:FinalExamSystems.IPaymentServiceAdapter.MakePayment(FinalExamSystems.Customer,System.Single)
member.summary: MakePayment method is the bluprint for the method that makes the Payment
member.param: Customer is mandatory as it contains informaiton relating to the payment
Total Price is mandatory
member.returns: Returns a boolean. It will be true if successful and false if not successful
